plotting_tools module¶

plotting_tools.get_bounds()[source]¶

Gets desired plotting bounds from user, returns None if no bounds

tuple
(min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y)
plotting_tools.plot(new_file, x_data, y_data, bounds, x_label='', y_label='')[source]¶

Saves a plot as ‘new_file.name’ on given bounds or auto-ranged bounds if none given.

Parameters:
  • new_file (File object) – file handle of plotting output file
  • x_data (list) – x_data to be plotted against
  • y_data (list) – y_data to be plotted
  • bounds (tuple) – bounds to be plotted against (min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y)
